item.title: How to use a histogram as a legend in {ggplot2}
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Land isn’t unemployed—people are. Here’s how to use R, {ggplot2}, {sf}, and {patchwork} to create a histogram legend in a choropleth map to better see the distribution of values.

item.title: How to move Crimea from Russia to Ukraine in maps with R
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Natural Earth’s de facto on-the-ground policy conflicts with de jure boundaries. Use {sf} and R to relocate parts of country shapes.

item.title: Using USAID data to make fancy world maps with Observable Plot
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Manipulate geographic data, change projections, get live data from a database, and make interactive plots with Observable JS

item.title: Guide to comparing sample and population proportions with CPS data, both classically and Bayesianly
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Download CPS demographic data from IPUMS and use R and {brms} to calculate differences between sample and national proportions with Bayesian ROPE-based inference

item.title: Apple Music Wrapped with R
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use R to parse Apple Music XML files and create your own Spotify Wrapped-like stats

item.title: Guide to generating and rendering computational markdown content programmatically with Quarto
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Learn how to use knitr::knit() in inline chunks to correctly render auto-generated R and markdown content in Quarto documents

item.title: Fun with Positron
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Combine the best of RStudio and Visual Studio Code in Posit’s new Positron IDE

item.title: Calculating the proportion of US state borders that are coastlines
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Measuring coastlines is hard and causes fractal paradoxes, but we can use R and {sf} to try!

item.title: Calculating birthday probabilities with R instead of math
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Probability math is hard. Use brute force simulation to find the probability that a household has a cluster of birthdays.

item.title: Visualizing {dplyr}’s mutate(), summarize(), group_by(), and ungroup() with animations
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Visually explore how {dplyr}’s more complex core functions work together to wrangle data

item.title: Demystifying causal inference estimands: ATE, ATT, and ATU
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Explore why we care about the ATE, ATT, and ATU and figure out how to calculate them with observational data

item.title: DIY API with Make and {plumber}
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use Make and {plumber} to create your own API and show live data in Quarto with R and Observable JS

item.title: How to create separate bibliographies in a Quarto document
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use multibib and Quarto to create separate bibliographies for a document and an appendix

item.title: Guide to understanding the intuition behind the Dirichlet distribution
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Learn about the Dirichlet distribution and explore how it’s just a fancier version of the Beta distribution

item.title: Manually generate predicted values for logistic regression with matrix multiplication in R
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: This is like basic stats stuff, but I can never remember how to do it—here’s how to use matrix multiplication to replicate the results of predict()

item.title: The ultimate practical guide to multilevel multinomial conjoint analysis with R
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Learn how to use R, {brms}, {marginaleffects}, and {tidybayes} to analyze discrete choice conjoint data with fully specified hierarchical multilevel multinomial models

item.title: How to fill maps with density gradients with R, {ggplot2}, and {sf}
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Fix overplotted points on maps by creating bins or filled desntiy gradients using R, {ggplot2}, and {sf}

item.title: The ultimate practical guide to conjoint analysis with R
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Learn how to use R, {brms}, and {marginaleffects} to analyze conjoint data and find causal and descriptive quantities of interest, both frequentistly and Bayesianly

item.title: Road trip analysis! How to use and play with Google Location History in R
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Learn how to use R to load and clean and play with all the location history data Google keeps about you and look at some neat plots and tables about our 5,000-mile summer road trip along the way

item.title: How to make fancy road trip maps with R and OpenStreetMap
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use R to get geocoded location and routing data from OpenStreetMap and explore our family’s impending 5,000 mile road trip around the USA

item.title: A guide to Bayesian proportion tests with R and {brms}
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use R, Stan, and {brms} to calculate differences between categorical proportions in a principled Bayesian way

item.title: Making Middle Earth maps with R
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Explore Tolkien’s Middle Earth with R-based GIS tools, including {ggplot2} and {sf}

item.title: How old was Aragorn in regular human years?
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use statistical simulation and a hidden table of Númenórean ages from Tolkien’s unpublished works to convert Aragorn’s Dúnedan years to actual human years

item.title: One Simple Trick™ to create inline bibliography entries with Markdown and pandoc
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: By default, pandoc doesn’t include full bibliographic references inline in documents, but with one tweak to a CSL file, you can create syllabus-like lists of citations with full references

item.title: How to migrate from BibDesk to Zotero for pandoc-based writing
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Tips, tricks, and rationale for converting from a single big BibTeX file to a Zotero database

item.title: How to use natural and base 10 log scales in ggplot2
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use the {scales} R package to automatically adjust and format x- and y-axis scales to use log base 10 and natural log values

item.title: Marginal and conditional effects for GLMMs with {marginaleffects}
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use the {marginaleffects} package to calculate tricky and nuanced marginal and conditional effects in generalized linear mixed models

item.title: Visualizing the differences between Bayesian posterior predictions, linear predictions, and the expectation of posterior predictions
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: A guide to different types of Bayesian posterior distributions and the nuances of posterior_predict, posterior_epred, and posterior_linpred

item.title: Quick and easy ways to deal with long labels in ggplot2
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Explore different manual and automatic ways to rotate, dodge, recode, break up, and otherwise deal with long axis labels with ggplot2

item.title: Marginalia: A guide to figuring out what the heck marginal effects, marginal slopes, average marginal effects, marginal effects at the mean, and all these other marginal things are
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Define what marginal effects even are, and then explore the subtle differences between average marginal effects, marginal effects at the mean, and marginal effects at representative values with the marginaleffects and emmeans R packages

item.title: A guide to modeling outcomes that have lots of zeros with Bayesian hurdle lognormal and hurdle Gaussian regression models
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Create, manipulate, understand, analyze, interpret, and plot Bayesian hurdle regression models (and a custom hurdle Gaussian model!) using R, the tidyverse, emmeans, brms, and Stan

item.title: How to create a(n almost) fully Bayesian outcome model with inverse probability weights
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use a posterior distribution of inverse probability weights in a Bayesian outcome model to conduct (nearly) fully Bayesian causal inference with R, brms, and Stan

item.title: How to use Bayesian propensity scores and inverse probability weights
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: For mathematical and philosophical reasons, propensity scores and inverse probability weights don’t work in Bayesian inference. But never fear! There’s still a way to do it!

item.title: A guide to working with country-year panel data and Bayesian multilevel models
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: How to use multilevel models with R and brms to work with country-year panel data.

item.title: A guide to correctly calculating posterior predictions and average marginal effects with multilievel Bayesian models
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: How to calculate grand means, conditional group means, and hypothetical group means of posterior predictions from multilevel brms models.

item.title: A guide to modeling proportions with Bayesian beta and zero-inflated beta regression models
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Everything you ever wanted to know about beta regression! Use R and brms to correctly model proportion data, and learn all about the beta distribution along the way.

item.title: Do-calculus adventures! Exploring the three rules of do-calculus in plain language and deriving the backdoor adjustment formula by hand
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use R to explore the three rules of do-calculus in plain language and derive the backdoor adjustment formula by hand

item.title: How to automatically convert TikZ images to SVG (with fonts!) from knitr
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Make knitr and R Markdown convert TikZ graphics to font-embedded SVG files when knitting to HTML

item.title: Exploring Pamela Jakiela’s simple TWFE diagnostics with R
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use R to explore possible biases that come from differential treatment timing in two-way fixed effects (TWFE) regression models

item.title: Exploring R² and regression variance with Euler/Venn diagrams
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use Venn diagrams to visualize the proportion of an outcome explained by a regression model

item.title: AFC Richmond / Ted Lasso cross stitch pattern
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Make your own Ted Lasso AFC Richmond crest cross stitch with a free pattern and an Illustrator template

item.title: Hex sticker/logo cross stitch pattern
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Make your own data science hex logo cross stitch with a free pattern and an Illustrator template

item.title: Bayesian (cross stitch) sampler
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Make your own Bayesian cross stitch sampler with a free pattern of Bayes Theorem and the accompanying Illustrator template

item.title: Marginal structural models for panel data with GEE and multilevel models
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use R to correctly close backdoor confounding in panel data with marginal structural models and inverse probability weights with both GEE and multilevel models

item.title: Generating inverse probability weights for marginal structural models with time-series cross-sectional panel data
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use R to close backdoor confounding in panel data with marginal structural models and inverse probability weights for both binary and continuous treatments

item.title: Generating inverse probability weights for both binary and continuous treatments
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use R to close backdoor confounding by generating and using inverse probability weights for both binary and continuous treatments

item.title: Emergency online teaching resources
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: List of resources to help teach online as universities rapidly shut down during the COVID-19 pandemic

item.title: Ways to close backdoors in DAGs
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use regression, inverse probability weighting, and matching to close confounding backdoors and find causation in observational data

item.title: Automatically zip up subdirectories with Make
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use a Makefile to automatically zip up all subdirectories in a given folder while also accounting for dependencies

item.title: Create a dynamic dashboard with R, flexdashboard, and Shiny
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use R Markdown, flexdashboard, and Shiny to create a dashboard that automatically loads data from a Google Sheet

item.title: Convert Markdown to rich text (with syntax highlighting!) in any macOS app
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Create a macOS Automator service to convert Markdown to rich text from any app in macOS

item.title: Chidi’s budget and utility: doing algebra and calculus with R and yacas
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use algebra and calculus with R and yacas to find Chidi’s optimal level of pizza and frozen yogurt consumption given his budget and utility function.

item.title: Half a dozen frequentist and Bayesian ways to measure the difference in means in two groups
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Learn how to run standard t-tests, simulations, and Bayesian difference in means tests with R and Stan

item.title: The academic job search finally comes to an end
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Explore 2.5 years of applying for academic jobs with fancy data visualization

item.title: How to test any hypothesis with the infer package
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use the infer package in R to test any statistical hypothesis through simulation.

item.title: Create a cheap, disposable supercomputer with R, DigitalOcean, and future
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use the future R package to run computationally intensive R commands on a cluster of remote computers

item.title: Show multiply imputed results in a side-by-side regression table with broom and huxtable
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Extend broom’s tidy() and glance() to work with lists of multiply imputed regression models

item.title: Meld regression output from multiple imputations with tidyverse
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use tidyverse functions to correctly meld and pool multiply imputed model output.

item.title: Fun with empirical and function-based derivatives in R
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: Use R to do things with derivatives, both with actual functions and with existing empirical data.

item.title: Working with R, Cairo graphics, custom fonts, and ggplot
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heiss
item.description: The Cairo graphics library makes it easy to embed custom fonts in PDFs and create high resolution PNGs (with either AGG or Cairo).
